reasoning: First off, Netflix falls outside my circle of competence. I stick to businesses I can wrap my head around like Coca-Cola, consumer staples, insurance or railroads – not a capital-intensive, rapidly evolving streaming service. Second, its moat looks questionable. While consistent operating margins suggest some pricing power, the inconsistency in ROE and the flood of competitors from Disney to Amazon erodes any lasting advantage. Third, management has grown the business aggressively, but there’s no dividend or buybacks, and content spending piles on debt – capital allocation feels more ‘spend to keep up’ than owner-friendly. Fourth, the balance sheet carries a debt-to-equity north of 2:1 and earnings growth has been lumpy, a far cry from the steady return streams I prefer. Fifth, the stock trades above our conservative intrinsic value estimate of about $25,600, leaving no margin of safety – you don’t want to pay more than a business is worth. Sixth, long-term prospects hinge on ever-higher content costs and technology shifts – real red flags for durability. Finally, compared to the strong franchises in my portfolio that I’d happily hold forever at reasonable prices, Netflix simply doesn’t measure up. If forced to choose, I’d pass and keep cash for a business with a moat I truly understand.

fundamental_analysis.details: Weak ROE of 13.2%; High debt to equity ratio of 2.1; Strong operating margins; Current ratio data not available

consistency_analysis.details: Inconsistent earnings growth pattern; Total earnings growth of 1174.3% over past 10 periods

moat_analysis.details: Inconsistent ROE: only 0/10 periods >15%; Strong and stable operating margins (avg: 39.8%) indicate pricing power moat; High performance stability (76.5%) suggests strong competitive moat

book_value_analysis.details: Consistent book value per share growth (Buffett's favorite metric); Good book value CAGR: 10.3%

management_analysis.details: No significant new stock issuance detected; No or minimal dividends paid

details: Using three-stage DCF: Stage 1 (8.0%, 5y), Stage 2 (4.0%, 5y), Terminal (2.5%)
